storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect overlapping appointments to avoid double bookings

testCases.title: Detect overlapping appointments on creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one existing appointment is scheduled (e.g., 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM)
Scheduler has access to the appointment creation interface
Appointment database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment creation page
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form is displayed with all required fields (date, time, duration, client, etc.)

steps.action: Enter appointment details that overlap with existing appointment (e.g., start time 2:30 PM, end time 3:30 PM when existing appointment is 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and displays the entered values

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: System flags the new appointment as conflicting and displays a conflict warning message indicating the overlapping time slot and existing appointment details

steps.action: Attempt to save the appointment without making changes
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving and displays conflict warning with message such as 'Cannot save: Appointment overlaps with existing appointment from 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM'

steps.action: Adjust the appointment time to a non-overlapping slot (e.g., change to 3:30 PM - 4:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict warning disappears and form shows no validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and the new appointment appears in the schedule without any conflict indicators

postconditions: New appointment is saved in the database with non-overlapping time slot
No conflicting appointments exist in the system
Scheduler remains on the scheduling interface or is redirected to appointment list
System audit log records the appointment creation

testCases.title: Detect overlapping appointments on update
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least two existing appointments are scheduled (e.g., Appointment A: 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM, Appointment B: 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
Scheduler has access to the appointment editing interface
Appointment database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment list and select Appointment B (4:00 PM - 5:00 PM) to edit
steps.expectedResult: Appointment edit form is displayed with current appointment details pre-populated

steps.action: Modify the appointment time to overlap with Appointment A (e.g., change start time to 2:30 PM, end time to 3:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the modified input and displays the updated values

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: System flags the updated appointment as conflicting and displays a conflict warning message indicating the overlapping time slot with Appointment A

steps.action: Attempt to save the updated appointment without resolving the conflict
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving and displays conflict warning with message such as 'Cannot update: Appointment overlaps with existing appointment from 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM'

steps.action: Click 'Cancel' button to abandon the update
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is closed and user is returned to the appointment list or calendar view

steps.action: Verify Appointment B details in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Original appointment remains unchanged with time slot 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM, no modifications were saved

postconditions: Appointment B retains its original time slot (4:00 PM - 5:00 PM)
No changes are saved to the database
No conflicting appointments exist in the system
Scheduler remains on the scheduling interface

testCases.title: Performance test for overlap detection latency
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple existing appointments are scheduled in the system
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure response time
System is under normal load conditions
Appointment database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Record the current timestamp and create a new appointment that overlaps with an existing appointment
steps.expectedResult: Appointment creation form accepts the input

steps.action: Click 'Save' button and measure the time until conflict detection message appears
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays warning message within 2 seconds of submission

steps.action: Record the elapsed time from submission to conflict detection
steps.expectedResult: Elapsed time is less than or equal to 2 seconds

steps.action: Cancel the conflicting appointment creation
steps.expectedResult: Form is closed without saving

steps.action: Initiate multiple concurrent appointment creations (5-10 appointments) with varying overlap scenarios using multiple browser sessions or automated scripts
steps.expectedResult: All appointment creation requests are submitted simultaneously

steps.action: Monitor and measure the conflict detection response time for each concurrent request
steps.expectedResult: System processes all conflict detections within 2 seconds for each request, maintaining SLA even under concurrent load

steps.action: Review performance logs and metrics
steps.expectedResult: All conflict detection operations completed within the 2-second SLA threshold with 100% accuracy

postconditions: No test appointments are saved in the database
System performance metrics are recorded and documented
System returns to normal operational state
Performance test results confirm SLA compliance

storyTitle: As Resource Manager, I want to detect double-booking of resources to optimize utilization

testCases.title: Detect resource double-booking on creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
At least one resource is available in the system (e.g., Conference Room A)
An existing booking exists for the resource (e.g., Conference Room A booked from 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM)
Resource Manager has access to the resource booking interface
Resource allocation database is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the resource booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Resource booking form is displayed with all required fields (resource type, resource name, date, time, duration, etc.)

steps.action: Select Conference Room A as the resource
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Enter booking details that overlap with the existing booking (e.g., start time 2:30 PM, end time 3:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the input and displays the entered values

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: System flags the new booking as conflicting and displays a conflict warning message indicating the resource is already booked during the specified time

steps.action: Attempt to save the booking without making changes
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving and displays conflict warning with message such as 'Cannot save: Conference Room A is already booked from 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM'

steps.action: Adjust the booking time to a non-overlapping slot (e.g., change to 3:30 PM - 4:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict warning disappears and form shows no validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: Booking is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and the new booking appears in the resource schedule without any conflict indicators

postconditions: New resource booking is saved in the database with non-overlapping time slot
No double-booked resources exist in the system
Resource Manager remains on the resource scheduling interface or is redirected to booking list
System audit log records the booking creation

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to validate participant availability to prevent scheduling conflicts

testCases.title: Validate participant availability on scheduling
preconditions: Scheduler user is logged into the system with valid credentials
Scheduler has permissions to create events and view participant availability
At least 3 participants exist in the system with active calendar data
Participant calendar APIs are accessible and responding
At least one participant has a conflicting event in their calendar
Scheduling UI is loaded and functional

steps.action: Navigate to the event creation page in the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed with fields for event details and participant selection

steps.action: Enter event title 'Project Review Meeting' and select date as tomorrow at 2:00 PM with duration of 1 hour
steps.expectedResult: Event details are populated in the form fields

steps.action: Click on the participant selection field and select 3 participants from the dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Selected participants are added to the event with their names displayed in the participant list

steps.action: Observe the system behavior as it retrieves participant availability data
steps.expectedResult: System initiates availability check and displays loading indicator. Availability data is retrieved within 2 seconds for all selected participants

steps.action: Review the availability status displayed for each participant
steps.expectedResult: System displays availability status for each participant. At least one participant shows as 'Unavailable' or 'Conflict' with conflict details visible (e.g., 'Busy: Client Meeting 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM')

steps.action: Verify that conflict alerts are prominently displayed in the scheduling UI
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert banner or notification is displayed showing 'Scheduling Conflict Detected' with details of which participants are unavailable and the conflicting time slots

steps.action: Click on the conflict details to view more information about the participant's unavailability
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information is displayed including participant name, conflicting event title, and time range

steps.action: Adjust the event time by changing the start time to 4:00 PM (a time when all participants are available)
steps.expectedResult: Event time is updated to 4:00 PM in the form

steps.action: Observe the system as it automatically revalidates participant availability for the new time slot
steps.expectedResult: System initiates automatic revalidation and displays loading indicator. Availability check completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Review the updated availability status for all participants
steps.expectedResult: All participants show as 'Available' with no conflict alerts displayed. Green checkmarks or 'Available' status indicators are shown next to each participant name

steps.action: Click the 'Create Event' or 'Schedule' button to finalize the event
steps.expectedResult: Event is successfully created with confirmation message displayed: 'Event scheduled successfully with all participants available'

postconditions: Event is created in the system with all participants confirmed as available
No scheduling conflicts exist for the selected time slot
Participants are added to the event in the database
Event appears in the scheduler's calendar view
Availability validation completed within performance threshold of 2 seconds
System logs record the availability checks and conflict detection

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling operations without conflicts to ensure data integrity

testCases.title: Handle concurrent scheduling operations without conflicts
preconditions: Test environment is configured with scheduling database and application servers
At least 100 test user accounts with scheduler role are created and active
Database transaction isolation level is properly configured
Concurrency control mechanisms (locking, transactions) are enabled in the system
Load testing tools or scripts are prepared to simulate concurrent users
Database monitoring tools are available to verify data consistency
Test data includes shared resources (rooms, participants) that multiple users may schedule
System performance monitoring is active to track operation completion times

steps.action: Prepare concurrent test scenario by configuring load testing tool to simulate 100 users simultaneously creating new events for the same time slot and shared resource (e.g., Conference Room A at 10:00 AM tomorrow)
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with 100 concurrent user sessions ready to execute scheduling operations

steps.action: Initiate the concurrent scheduling operations by triggering all 100 users to submit event creation requests simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: System receives 100 concurrent POST requests to the scheduling endpoint. All requests are queued and processed by the system

steps.action: Monitor system behavior during concurrent operations using application logs and performance monitoring tools
steps.expectedResult: System applies concurrency control mechanisms (database locks, transaction management). No application errors or crashes occur. System remains responsive

steps.action: Wait for all 100 concurrent operations to complete and observe the response times
steps.expectedResult: All operations complete within SLA thresholds. System processes requests sequentially or with proper conflict detection. Response times are logged for each operation

steps.action: Review the responses received by each of the 100 simulated users
steps.expectedResult: Only one user receives success confirmation for booking Conference Room A at 10:00 AM. The remaining 99 users receive clear feedback messages such as 'Resource unavailable' or 'Scheduling conflict detected - room already booked'

steps.action: Query the scheduling database to verify the number of events created for Conference Room A at 10:00 AM tomorrow
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns exactly 1 event record for the specified time and resource. No duplicate bookings exist

steps.action: Execute database consistency check queries to verify referential integrity, constraint violations, and orphaned records
steps.expectedResult: All database integrity checks pass. No constraint violations, no orphaned records, no data corruption detected. Foreign key relationships are intact

steps.action: Prepare second concurrent test scenario with 100 users updating different existing events simultaneously (non-conflicting updates)
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with 100 users each updating a unique event record

steps.action: Execute the concurrent update operations by triggering all 100 users to submit PUT requests simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: System receives and processes 100 concurrent PUT requests. Concurrency controls are applied

steps.action: Monitor and wait for all update operations to complete
steps.expectedResult: All 100 update operations complete successfully within SLA thresholds. No deadlocks or transaction rollbacks occur

steps.action: Verify that all 100 events were updated correctly by querying the database and comparing with expected update values
steps.expectedResult: All 100 event records show the correct updated values. No updates were lost or overwritten incorrectly. Data consistency is maintained

steps.action: Prepare third concurrent test scenario with 50 users creating events and 50 users updating events simultaneously (mixed operations)
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is configured with mixed operation types across 100 concurrent users

steps.action: Execute the mixed concurrent operations simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: System processes 100 concurrent mixed operations (50 creates, 50 updates) without errors

steps.action: Verify operation results and database state after mixed concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: All create operations result in new records or appropriate conflict messages. All update operations complete successfully or return appropriate feedback. Database remains consistent with no data corruption

steps.action: Review application logs and user feedback messages for all concurrent test scenarios
steps.expectedResult: Users receive clear, accurate feedback on operation status. Success messages for completed operations show 'Event created successfully' or 'Event updated successfully'. Conflict messages clearly state 'Unable to complete operation - resource conflict' or similar. No ambiguous or missing feedback

steps.action: Generate and review performance report showing concurrent user support and operation completion times
steps.expectedResult: Report confirms system successfully supported 100 concurrent scheduling users. Average operation completion time is within SLA thresholds. No performance degradation beyond acceptable limits

postconditions: Database contains accurate scheduling data with no corruption or inconsistencies
All concurrent operations are logged with appropriate status (success/conflict)
System demonstrated support for 100 concurrent users without data conflicts
No orphaned records or referential integrity violations exist in the database
All users received appropriate feedback on their operation status
Performance metrics confirm operations completed within SLA thresholds
Concurrency control mechanisms functioned correctly throughout all test scenarios
System remains stable and responsive after concurrent load testing
